articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told families of hostages held in Gaza that a deal that would secure their loved ones' release could be nearing, his office said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu says deal could be nearing for hostages in Gaza

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris will campaign in the critical battleground state of Wisconsin on Tuesday for the first time as a presidential candidate after enough Democratic delegates pledged to endorse her, clearing her path to the nomination.
articles.title: Harris closes in on nomination with delegates secured, to campaign in Wisconsin

articles.author: Mohammad Ponir Hossain
articles.description: The Bangladesh government is expected to formally accept on Tuesday a court ruling to lower quotas for state jobs, media reported, meeting a key demand of the students who had been protesting for days.
articles.title: After protests, Bangladesh government to formally accept ruling on job quotas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A chartered flight carrying 123 Malaysians evacuated from deadly violence in Bangladesh arrived in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday, Malaysia's home minister said.
articles.title: Flight carrying 123 Malaysians evacuated from Bangladesh arrives home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French security services have been probing migrant communities from former Soviet republics in an effort to safeguard the Olympics from the ISIS-K militant group, the interior minister said, confirming a Reuters report published last week.
articles.title: France probed migrant communities to fight ISIS-K threat to Olympics

articles.author: Walid Berrazeg
articles.description: Taiwan curtailed its annual Han Kuang war games on Tuesday as Typhoon Gaemi barrelled towards the island and the government issued a land warning given the expected strong winds and torrential rain as it hits the coast.
articles.title: Taiwan curtails annual war games as Typhoon Gaemi barrels towards island

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin on Tuesday said that Russia's cooperation with China in the Arctic was not aimed against any other country and said U.S. criticism of such work was misplaced.
articles.title: Kremlin says Russian Arctic cooperation with China is not aimed against anyone after Pentagon expresses concern

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prosecutors in the southern Italian city of Crotone have informed two members of the coastguard and four police officers that they may face further action over a migrant shipwreck that killed at least 94 people, they said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Italian prosecutors investigate officials over Cutro migrant shipwreck

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Andean condor being treated in Chile with lead in its blood, a pellet embedded in its skull and a satellite tracker from Argentina highlights the challenges of conserving this endangered bird.
articles.title: Andean condor in rehab highlights conservation challenges

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Sunday, July 21 was the hottest day ever recorded globally, according to preliminary data from the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service.
articles.title: World registers hottest day ever recorded on July 21, monitor says
